page.title: 19WETHERBY - IN NORTH YORKS.?
page.content: In the 1974 reorganisation the Boundary Commission placed Harrogate in West Yorkshire, under the control of Leeds. Harrogate opposed their inclusion in West Yorkshire and as a result became part of North Yorkshire. A similar campaign of opposition has now been proposed with the aim of transfering Wetherby into N. Yorks. Within the Wetherby ward a commission (politically unbiased) was established to investigate the advantages of moving into North Yorkshire. They said "It follows that the market town of Wetherby and its surrounding rural villages, many of which are in North Yorkshire, cannot be described as Metropolitan in any way." Two other factors favour the case for North Yorkshire, these are higher per capita spending on education and a lower rate compared to Leeds.
